text: This is a list of regions of the Dominican Republic by Human Development Index as of 2018. {| class="wikitable sortable" ! class="sort" |Rank ! class="sort" |Region ! class="sort" |HDI (2018) ! class="unsortable" |Comparable countries (2018) |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#0c0;" |High human development |- |1 | style="text-align:left" |Distrito Nacional, Santo Domingo, Monte Plata |0.764 |, |- |2 | style="text-align:left" |Espaillat, Puerto Plata, Santiago |0.755 | |- style="background:#e6e6e6" |– | style="text-align:left" |'''''' |0.745 | |- |3 | style="text-align:left" |Duarte, Maria Trinidad Sanchez, Hermanas Mirabal, Samana |0.745 | |- |4 | style="text-align:left" |La Vega, Monsenor Nouel, Sanchez Ramirez |0.737 |, |- |5 | style="text-align:left" |Peravia, San Cristobal, San José de Ocoa, Azua |0.733 | |- |6 | style="text-align:left" |El Seibo, La Altagracia, La Romana, San Pedro de Macoris, Hato Mayor |0.728 |, |- |7 | style="text-align:left" |Independencia, Bahoruco, Barahona, Pedernales Province |0.706 |, , |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#fc0;" |Medium human development |- |8 | style="text-align:left" |San Juan, Elias Pina |0.697 | |- |9 | style="text-align:left" |Dajabon, Monte Cristi, Santiago Rodriguez, Valverde |0.694 | |- |} == References == Dominican Republic Human Development Index Governorates by Human Development Index
title: List of regions of the Dominican Republic by Human Development Index
